prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. Evaluate $\lceil-2.4\rceil$.
solution: The smallest integer that is greater than or equal to $-2.4$ is $-2$. Therefore, $\lceil-2.4\rceil=\boxed{-2}$.
gpt_response: Okie dokie! So we have a number -2.4 and we want to see what's the closest whole number that is smaller than it. Let's think....Hmm...-3 is smaller than -2.4. So, when we round -2.4 up to the nearest whole number, we get -3! Yippee! 🌟
solution_prompt: Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to -2?: Okie dokie! So we have a number -2.4 and we want to see what's the closest whole number that is smaller than it. Let's think....Hmm...-3 is smaller than -2.4. So, when we round -2.4 up to the nearest whole number, we get -3! Yippee! 🌟
